content.description: Start at the top of the giant boulder in the middle of the crag and follow the diagonal crack up and to the right.

Climb the small holds on the face. Work slightly to the left through the crux, aiming for a bulge that turns out to be a very welcome flake. Easier going as you head diagonally right to skirt a small overhang.
content.protection: Not much and not good.  Best toproped.  Be warned the holds have a tendency to blow off with no warning. Best top roped.
content.location: On the right side of the crag.  Between 2 large hemlocks growing next to the rock.

content.description: Large tapering chimney behind a large hemlock tree on right side of crag.
content.protection: Trees at top for TR anchors.

content.description: The steep, flat face to the left of the big boulder.  Small, sharp holds.  Good top roping.
content.protection: Small stuff. Trees at top for TR anchors.
content.location: Scramble up the left side of the massive boulder in the middle of the crag.

content.description: Climb the face and small crack between the big Lightheaded crack and the arete at far right of crag.

climbs.name: Merry Go Round
climbs.fa: Ken Nichols, Paul Ledoux, Al Rubin, June 1980

content.description: The arete at the far right of the crag. The rating seems a bit high.  Stay on the arete for 5.9.
content.protection: Not much.  Small wires.  Trees at top for TR anchors.

content.description: Climb the crack about 8 feet from the arete on the far right of the crag.  A nice lead for the grade.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Trees at top for TR anchors.

content.description: An excellent face climb up the left side of the big face between Green Goddess and the Tangled Up in Green chimney.  The route is supposed to start 3-4 feet right of the Green Goddess crack but there are few distinct features so you can pretty much start where you like.
content.protection: This route is usually top-roped due to the paucity of protection until you reach the traverse crack. Trees at top for TR anchors.

content.description: In the dead center of the crag is a face climb with an old bolt hole.  The top-out might be the crux.  Without this bolt, this one is probably R/X.

climbs.name: Green Gripper
climbs.fa: Paul Ledoux, Al Rubin, Ken Nichols, June 1980

content.description: The left arete of the Tangled Up in Green chimney.
content.protection: Trees at top for TR anchors

content.description: Small, short chimney.  Also, try the cracks on the left (5.5).
content.protection: Standard rack.  A large cam or two might be nice. Trees at top for TR anchors.
content.location: Starts on top of the massive boulder in the middle of the crag.

content.description: Bouldery moves up the face between the arete at the far right of the crag and the Captain Kangaroo corner.
content.protection: Not much.  Small stuff.  Suitable trees at top for top rope anchors.
content.location: Around the corner at the far right of the crag

content.description: A short dihedral.  Climb the crack in the corner.
content.protection: Standard small rack. Suitable trees at top for top rope anchors.
content.location: Around the corner at the far right of the crag.

climbs.name: Bleu Cheese
climbs.fa: Bob Clark, Ken Nichols, Bill Sullivan, July 1981

content.description: An excellent face climb up the right side of the big face between Green Goddess and the Tangled Up in Green chimney.
content.protection: Almost nothing until you get to the Traverse of the Goddess horizontal crack.
content.location: Trees at top for TR anchors.

content.description: A shady crag a bit north of Rattlesnake rock proper.
